means: 指责，谴责，控告( accuse的现在分词 )

sentence.Network_en: He was accusing my mum of having an affair with another man.
sentence.Network_cn: 他指责我妈妈与另一个男人有染。

sentence.Network_en: The accusing look in her eyes conveyed her sense of betrayal.
sentence.Network_cn: 她责备的眼神中流露出一种被骗的神情。

sentence.Network_en: By accusing the King of murder, he signed his own death warrant.
sentence.Network_cn: 他指控国王谋杀，从而让自己走上了绝路。

PerfectNetExp.abs: accuser 原告accusing 责难的accusingly 责难地
more recently he has railed against " market failure " , accusing big clients of investment banks challenging the fees and margins they are charged .最近他开始抱怨“市场的低迷”，他指责投资银行的大客户对银行的各项收费的无动于衷。
opposition politicians reacted angrily , accusing the Government of already making up its mind without the " promised consultation " .反对派政治家们对此做出了愤怒的反应，他们指责政府未经“保证协商”步骤便擅自作出了决定。
he gave me an accusing look .他责备地看了我一眼。

list.abs: 英文字典_百度文库 ... accusation 罪状;罪名 accuse 控告;指责 accustom 使习惯.
2012年职称英语词汇表最新完整版 - 豆丁网 ... accusation n． 告发，控告 accuse vt． 1． 指责 2．控告 accustom vt． 使习惯.
梵文_百度百科 ... 主格 Nominative 宾格（accusative） Accusative 用格 Instrumental.
英语新词汇与常用词汇的翻译(A) ... accuse 控告 accuser 原告 accusing 责难的.

entry.def: If you look at someone with an accusing expression or speak to them in an accusing tone of voice, you are showing that you think they have done something wrong.

example.ex: The accusing look in her eyes conveyed her sense of betrayal.
example.tran: 她责备的眼神中流露出一种被骗的神情。
